msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Portions of a treatise on surgery. Parts of the second chapter and all of the third chapter of the 3-chapter treatise, which is the last of the 30 treatises in the Taṣrīf li-man ʻajiza ʻan al-taʼlīf, a larger work by al-Zahrāwī. Topics in the manuscript include incision, perforation, blood-letting, wounds, bone-setting, dislocations, and sprains. Contemporary corrections in margins; additional notes in a maghribi script also in margins.

persName.#text: Abū al-Qāsim Khalaf ibn ʻAbbās al-Zahrāwī, -1013
أبو القاسم خلف بن عباس الزهراوي،

supportDesc.extent: 108 leaves : 177 x 125 (135 x 90) mm bound to 177 x 140 mm

collation.p: Paper, 108; 1¹² 2⁸ 3¹² 4⁴ 5⁸ 6¹² 7⁸ 8¹² 9⁸ 10-11¹²; [1-85, i, 86-107]; modern foliation in pencil, upper center recto. Catchword on each leaf, lower left verso.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in naskh script in black ink in two hands; partially pointed, further points added by a later hand.

decoNote: Numerous illustrations of surgical instruments in black or black and red ink; rubrications in red.

decoNote.#text: Illustration, Surgical instrument, f. i verso

binding.p: Bound in light brown leather over pasteboard with flap (Type II); blind stamped central mandorla, border and foliate frame; plain paper doublure.

provenance: Sold at auction at Sotheby's, 2 Apr. 2002, lot 23, to Lawrence J. Schoenberg.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2011.

term: Surgical instruments and apparatus--Early works to 1800
